page.title: 01Boston
page.content: Boston is situated in the Fenland of Easten England with population of 26,000.It is situated on the mouth of the river Witham.It has a port that can handle upto 400,000 tonne of cargo as well small and declining fishing industry.The town has a very varied history from a{boom_town}of the early 13th century even outstripping London as a port.It is since declined to a small market town. Its fame lies in its Parish church,St. Botolphs which is nicknamed {"the Stump" }which can be viewed from upto 30 miles from the level country_side. It is also known because of its connection with Boston,Massachusetts, America,which was named after{Boston, {England }by early settlers in America. This connection brings many tourists throughout the year to Boston to explore this link.
